comment:
* Used to communicate information about what is changing during a transition to a TransitionPlayer.
 * @hide

variables.name: mType
variables.comment: The type of the transition being requested.

variables.name: mTriggerTask
variables.comment:
* If non-null, the task containing the activity whose lifecycle change (start or
     * finish) has caused this transition to occur.

variables.name: mPipTask
variables.comment:
* If non-null, the task containing the pip activity that participates in this
     * transition.

variables.name: mRemoteTransition
variables.comment: If non-null, a remote-transition associated with the source of this transition.

variables.name: mDisplayChange
variables.comment:
* If non-null, this request was triggered by this display change. This will not be complete:
     * The reliable parts should be flags, rotation start/end (if rotating), and start/end bounds
     * (if size is changing).

variables.name: mFlags
variables.comment: The transition flags known at the time of the request. These may not be complete.

variables.name: mDebugId
variables.comment: This is only a BEST-EFFORT id used for log correlation. DO NOT USE for any real work!

methods.name: public int getType()
methods.comment: * The type of the transition being requested.

methods.name: public ActivityManager.RunningTaskInfo getTriggerTask()
methods.comment:
* If non-null, the task containing the activity whose lifecycle change (start or
     * finish) has caused this transition to occur.

methods.name: public ActivityManager.RunningTaskInfo getPipTask()
methods.comment:
* If non-null, the task containing the pip activity that participates in this
     * transition.

methods.name: public RemoteTransition getRemoteTransition()
methods.comment: * If non-null, a remote-transition associated with the source of this transition.

methods.name: public TransitionRequestInfo.DisplayChange getDisplayChange()
methods.comment:
* If non-null, this request was triggered by this display change. This will not be complete:
     * The reliable parts should be flags, rotation start/end (if rotating), and start/end bounds
     * (if size is changing).

methods.name: public int getFlags()
methods.comment: * The transition flags known at the time of the request. These may not be complete.

methods.name: public int getDebugId()
methods.comment: * This is only a BEST-EFFORT id used for log correlation. DO NOT USE for any real work!

methods.name: public TransitionRequestInfo setTriggerTask(@android.annotation.NonNull ActivityManager.RunningTaskInfo value)
methods.comment:
* If non-null, the task containing the activity whose lifecycle change (start or
     * finish) has caused this transition to occur.

methods.name: public TransitionRequestInfo setPipTask(@android.annotation.NonNull ActivityManager.RunningTaskInfo value)
methods.comment:
* If non-null, the task containing the pip activity that participates in this
     * transition.

methods.name: public TransitionRequestInfo setRemoteTransition(@android.annotation.NonNull RemoteTransition value)
methods.comment: * If non-null, a remote-transition associated with the source of this transition.

methods.name: public TransitionRequestInfo setDisplayChange(@android.annotation.NonNull TransitionRequestInfo.DisplayChange value)
methods.comment:
* If non-null, this request was triggered by this display change. This will not be complete:
     * The reliable parts should be flags, rotation start/end (if rotating), and start/end bounds
     * (if size is changing).

methods.name: public void writeToParcel(@android.annotation.NonNull android.os.Parcel dest, int flags)

methodNames: public void writeToParcel(@android.annotation.NonNull android.os.Parcel dest, int flags)
